verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
I'm climbing a mountain
Just over the valley a mountain so high
I can't see to the top I stood at the bottom
And wondered if I could make it.
Then something within me said, I'd have to try
So mountain move over,
'Cause I'm climbing to heaven.
I know that the way is rough and hard,
But I'll find the other.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
I'm crossing a river, just over the valley,
There's people who say
It's too deep and too wide.
But there is a Man
They don't know, who will guide me.
He's been there before
So I'll follow behind.
So river just bow your head,
And let us cross over.
'Cause I'm going to sing and dance on you,
Till I reach the other side.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
The mountain and river, Are now far behind me.
I know it's been hard
But it seems like a dream.
I'm feasting on ridges
And drinking from fountains
Of sweet waters that never run dry.
So there is no mountain
That's too high to cross over.
And there is no river
That's so deep you will drown.
So lift up your eyes
And look beyond the horizon
And follow the morning star.
And like me, you will find the other side.
